body.section: Reference sets, or Refsets as they are more commonly known, are formal representations for identifying subsets of a terminology for specific purposes, and which conform to the IHTSDO's reference set specifications. Uses can include language specific termsets, value sets for constraining data element values, mappings between two terminologies, navigation support for data entry, and many other potential applications. A refset is a set of concepts, descriptions, or relationships that are appropriate to a particular language, dialect, country, specialty, organization, user or context. In its simplest form, a refset is a list of Universally Unique Identifiers (UUIDs), where each UUID refers to one component of the terminology hierarchy, and makes it a member of the refset (a refset member). The creation and editing of Refsets is described in the Workbench User Guide.

Refsets are being increasingly adopted for SNOMED distributions by IHTSDO affiliate organisations. Adoption of the new Release Format 2 (RF2) distribution file format and the general processing of refsets are both still evolving. The IHTSDO Workbench provides a number of tools and processes to support these.
